After this city's Hmong-American mayor Sheng Thao was recalled, 78-year-old Barbara Lee was elected mayor in a 2025 special election. In 2020, this city settled a lawsuit from victims of the Ghost Ship warehouse fire in its (*) Fruitvale neighborhood. A stadium in this city home to the view-ruining "Mount Davis" was home to a team owned by John Fisher that now plays in Sutter Health Park. In 2025, that sports team based in this city temporarily moved to the state capital after failing to secure a replacement for its Coliseum. For 10 points, name this California city, once home to the Athletics.

2. "Exclusion zones" inside of this structure are maintained by the mammalian protein Tpr. Transport of molecules greater than 60 kilodaltons into this structure relies on liquid–liquid phase separation facilitated by intrinsically disordered FG-Nups. This structure contains RCC1, which is a bound GEF that maintains a gradient of high Ran-GTP concentration inside this structure. This organelle's (*) eight-fold-symmetric openings contain cytoplasmic filaments and namesake “baskets.” Traffic into and out of this organelle is mediated by importins and exportins. 18. An approach first developed to treat this disorder uses collaborative empiricism. Maria Kovacs developed an assessment for this disorder in children, which is also measured by PHQ-9. An inventory first proposed for diagnosing this disorder assesses beliefs about the world, the future, and the self and was developed by (*) Aaron T. Beck. [10m] Surgeons use this type of minimally invasive procedure to investigate a joint via a fiber optic camera prior to surgery. This procedure is used for routine colon cancer screenings.
ANSWER: endoscopy [or arthroscopy or endoscopic surgery or arthroscopic surgery; prompt on colonoscopy by asking "what is the more general term?"]
[10e] To make space for arthroscopic surgery, surgeons can use the "normal" type of this crystalloid fluid as an irrigation fluid. This solution of NaCl is provided intravenously to prevent dehydration.
ANSWER: saline [or saline solution or normal saline solution; prompt on NSS or NS or N-slash-S]
[10h] This condition can result from extravasation of the irrigation fluid into soft tissue around a joint. This condition is swelling in response to the buildup of fluid in a tissue.
ANSWER: edema [prompt on fluid retention or hydropsy]

15. The "desperate lives and troubled times" that led to this work's creation are studied in a 2024 book by Charles King, which calls it "the greatest piece of participatory art ever created." For 10 points each:
[10m] Name this choral work with a libretto by Charles Jennens whose opening French overture in E minor is labeled a Sinfony. This work depicts shepherds in its "Pifa."
ANSWER: Messiah [or HWV 56]
[10h] King's book has this two-word title. After the accompanied recitative ("re-sit-uh-TEEV") "Comfort ye, my people," the first aria in Messiah claims "[this phrase] shall be exalted."
ANSWER: Every Valley [accept "Ev'ry valley shall be exalted"]
[10e] The most famous excerpt of Handel's Messiah is the final scene of Part II, which is a chorus titled for this word.
ANSWER: hallelujah

16. Intrinsic alignment causes correlation patterns that get conflated with the presence of this phenomenon. For 10 points each:
[10h] Name this phenomenon whose "weak" form is observed from shared properties of adjacent bodies and whose "micro" form is observed as a brightening.
ANSWER: gravitational lensing [accept weak gravitational lensing or weak lensing or microlensing]
[10e] The cosmic shear from weak gravitational lensing is computed by measuring the extent to which faraway galaxies deviate from this shape. Most large galaxies are either spirals or have this shape.
ANSWER: elliptical [or ellipse]
[10m] Weak gravitational lensing converts this field's E-mode polarization into B-mode polarization. The Planck satellite observed this 2.7-kelvin blackbody.
ANSWER: CMBR [or cosmic microwave background radiation]

17. Answer the following about the history of in vitro fertilization, for 10 points each.
[10m] The government of this country suppressed news about the birth of the second-ever "test-tube baby" in 1978. This country's IIT system has produced many scientists.
ANSWER: India [or Republic of India; or Bhārat Gaṇarājya]
[10h] This man expressed fear about women becoming "baby factories" when interviewed about test-tube baby Louise Brown. This man died just 33 days after being elected the successor of Paul VI in 1978.
ANSWER: Pope John Paul I [or Albino Luciani; or Ioannes Paulus I or Giovanni Paolo I; prompt on John Paul; reject "John" or "Paul" alone]
[10e] International surrogacy, made possible by IVF, has largely replaced international adoption from countries such as this one, whose orphanages overflowed during the reign of Communist dictator Nicolae Ceaușescu ("chow-SHESS-koo").
ANSWER: Romania [or Socialist Republic of Romania]

19. Activists who oppose this region's merger with two others in 2016 often fly the "red-and-white" flag. For 10 points each:
[10m] Name this French region in the Grand Est that is home to a flatbread called tarte flambée. This region's largest city is Strasbourg, and 90 percent of it was ceded to Germany in 1871.
ANSWER: Alsace [prompt on Alsace-Lorraine]
[10h] These mountains, whose highest point is Grand Ballon, shelter the vineyards of Alsace. Garibaldi led an army named for these mountains during the Franco-Prussian War.
ANSWER: Vosges Mountains [or Vogesen]

ANSWER: Jurassic Period [accept Late Jurassic Period or Jura Mountains]

20. The 2013 film Reaching for the Moon depicts this poet's lesbian relationship with Lota de Macedo Soares ("LOH-tah jee mah-SAY-doo SWAH-ress"). For 10 points each:
[10m] Name this poet who referenced her time in Brazil with the line "some realms I owned, two rivers, a continent" in "One Art," which claims "the art of losing isn't hard to master."
ANSWER: Elizabeth Bishop
[10h] With her partner Louise Crane, Bishop lived in one of the "three loved houses" described in "One Art" in this American city, where she befriended Pauline Pfeiffer Hemingway and wrote “The Fish.”
ANSWER: Key West, Florida
[10e] Several years after Soares's suicide, Bishop wrote a poem about this castaway from a novel by Daniel Defoe. In Bishop’s poem, this character laments the death of his lover, Friday.
ANSWER: Robinson Crusoe [or Robinson Crusoe; accept "Crusoe in England"]
<Forrest Weintraub, Literature - American - Poetry> ~24698~ <Editor: Jaimie Carlson>

21. A member of this group published an article criticizing Hai Rui Dismissed from Office, which its author said glorified Peng Dehuai. For 10 points each:

ANSWER: Gang of Four [or Sì rén bāng]
[10e] The Gang of Four’s influence grew during this movement launched by Mao Zedong, which purged capitalist elements from society through cadres called the Red Guards.
ANSWER: Cultural Revolution [or Great Proletarian Cultural Revolution; or Wénhuà Dà Gémìng]

ANSWER: Hua Guofeng [or Su Zhu]
